boat.construction_details: GRP hard chine hull with Sitka Spruce spars

for_sales.sales_text:
Chione is a Tradewind Atoll, a traditional gaff rigged cutter which punches well above her weight for a boat of just over 25’ on deck in terms of both sailing ability and accommodation.  Chione has only had two owners from new and when she was commissioned in 1998 she was built by Blondcell Marine and fitted-out by Martyn Brake to very high standards. 

Offering accommodation for a crew of 4, Chione has been well thought out for family cruising.  She provides generously proportioned berths, a separate heads compartment, dedicated chart table, galley with 2 burner gas stove, grill and oven, Origo marincool fridge, Eberspacher heating, 60ltr stainless steel fuel tank, 135ltr freshwater tank, heads holding tank (heads can also discharge overboard), a Yanmar 2GM20F diesel engine with shaft drive to 3-blade fixed prop, shore power system, Lewmar anchor windlass, Simrad instruments, Garmin GPS, VHF, stereo, and a TP300 tiller pilot.  The bowsprit can be retracted easily.  Chione has been maintained ashore annually and benefits from a new mast (Collars – 2022), Victron shore-power battery charger (2023), Coppercoat antifoul (professionally applied during 2024) and a new mainsail cover (2024).

Still in immaculate condition below and good condition on deck, Chione has only been lightly used and is a lovely example of this robust class of gaffer

boat.full_description: Chione T's hull was moulded by Blondecell Marine of Lymington before being fitted out to her first owner's specification by Martyn Brake Yachts, Poole.  She is a solidly constructed and sturdy gaff cutter with a lot of accommodation space for her size.  Her British Racing Green hull makes her stand out.  Having spent several years on Loch Craignish on the west coast of Scotland, she returned to the Solent in 2018, and then moved to Plymouth in 2020.  She is now berthed in King Point Marina.
boat.name: Chione T
